comments.raw_text: The session tickets generated by the server-side of libssl do not try to pad the DER encoding of the client certificate. This means it could be easy to infer (and/or narrow down) what client certificate is included in the session ticket, my measuring its length. The server should either pad the client certificate, or it should include just a cryptographic hash of the client certificate chain in the ticket that it can look up later in a cache that maps the hashes back to cert chains.
comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
